intro: Leptochloa liebmannii, commonly known as Liebmann's grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and slender stems that are often prostrate or decumbent. It is well adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a characteristic component of dryland ecosystems.
